title: Ticket #2970: CONDOR_INHERIT causes recursive glideins to misbehave
description:
In a test of Igor's CrosOSG CE, there is a glidein within a glidein. The inner glidein failed shortly after being started, because the master was trying to send a CHILDALIVE message to the outer glidein. This failed due to authorization errors.

The inner glidein should not be trying to send CHILDALIVE messages to the outer glidein. The reason it is trying to do so is that the CONDOR_INHERIT environment variable is being passed to the job executed by the outer glidein.

Proposed fix: remove CONDOR_INHERIT from the environment as soon as it is read in DaemonCore. It should never be passed to a child process of a daemon.
remarks:
2012-May-03 14:34:45 by danb:
I learned more: CONDOR_INHERIT is passed to the job when JOB_INHERITS_STARTER_ENVIRONMENT is true. Otherwise, it is not passed. Furthermore, the value is explicitly set by the starter in DaemonCore::CreateProcess(). It is not just a value left over from what the starter itself inherited.

2012-Oct-08 14:53:03 by tannenba:
Code Review. I wonder if scheduler universe has a similar issue, and seems like it would be easy to write a regression test for this. But the code patch itself looks fine, so resolving.
